cupp::kernel_call_traits

cupp::kernel_call_traits< host_type, device_type > Class Template Reference

These traits define the behavior of what happens when a kernel is called. More...

Detailed Description

template<typename host_type, typename device_type>
class cupp::kernel_call_traits< host_type, device_type >

These traits define the behavior of what happens when a kernel is called.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename host_type, typename device_type>
static device_type cupp::kernel_call_traits< host_type, device_type >::get_host_based_device_copy ( const device &  d,
const host_type &  that 
) [inline, static]

Creates a copy of our data for the device in host memory.

Parameters:
d The device the kernel will be executed on
that The object that is about to be passed to the kernel
Note:
This function is called when you pass a parameter by value to a kernel.

template<typename host_type, typename device_type>
static void cupp::kernel_call_traits< host_type, device_type >::dirty ( const device &  d,
const host_type &  that,
shared_device_pointer< device_type >  device_copy 
) [inline, static]

This function is when the value may have been changed on the device.

Parameters:
d The device the kernel will be executed on
that The host representation of your data
device_copy The pointer you created with get_device_based_device_copy
Note:
This function is only called if you pass a parameter by non-const reference to a kernel.
